section.p:
Agora recommends the following steps to use multiple cameras for video capture and publishing when a camera is already in use:
Call this method to enable multi-camera capture.
Call startPreview to start the local video preview.
Call and set sourceType to start capturing with the second camera.
Call and set publishSecondaryCameraTrack to to publish the video stream captured by the second camera. To disable multi-camera capture:
Call .
Call this method and set enabled to . This method is only available on iOS.Ensure the system version is 13.0 or later when using this feature.The minimum supported iOS device models for multi-camera capture are:
iPhone XR
iPhone XS
iPhone XS Max
iPad Pro (3rd generation and later)
section.note:
You can call this method to enable multi-camera capture either before or after calling startPreview:
If enabled before startPreview, the local preview displays the views from both cameras.
If enabled after startPreview, the SDK stops the current camera capture, then enables both the main and secondary cameras. The preview briefly turns black and then recovers automatically.

plentry.pd:
